text: is a Shinto shrine located in Tenri, Nara in Japan. It worships Yamato Okunitama The royal family started supporting the shrine in the Heian period. In 965, Emperor Murakami had a messenger go to the shrine to report things to the god. == Related pages == * List of Shinto shrines in Japan * Twenty-Two Shrines * Modern system of ranked Shinto shrines == References == Category:Twenty-Two Shrines Category:Myōjin Taisha Category:Beppyo shrines Category:Kanpei-taisha Category:Nara Prefecture
title: Ōyamato Shrine
